name: Hampton Inn Milford

reviews.text: We started staying here when we decided last minute to stay overnight when dropping our daughter off freshman year at Yale. At that last minute none of the hotels closer to Yale were available so we stayed here. It is now our usual spot,as it is far less expensive than the places close in. And given that if you're not staying right on top of the Yale campus, you're going to have to get in your car and drive anyway, it hardly seems worth it to spend $50 more to be a few miles closer. This Hampton is 11 miles south on 95 from the New Haven exit. The place is simple, but we found it clean and comfortable, with the usual Hampton Inn free breakfast, and free parking. Extremely easy on easy off Rt. 95.
reviews.title: convenient to Yale

reviews.text: Like many families in my area, my wife and I sough out hotel accommodations while we were without power during Hurricane Irene. Most of the hotels in the area were filled to capacity as was this Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Stayed during Hurricane Irene Power Outage

reviews.text: The staff at this property is without equal. Each and every staff person I encountered during my three day stay was friendly and courteous. The folks at the front desk were kind and thoughful, aware of the fact that we had been displaced from our home. The staff people who tended to the daily breakfast were cheerful and attentive. They made certain that the breakfast area was spotlessly clean and breakfast items were regualrly replenished.
reviews.title: We Found Refuge at the Hampton Inn Post-Hurricane Irene

reviews.text: The facility itself though is starting to show its age. The lobby is small and not well suited for sitting and chatting with friends or family. The rooms and the furniture in the rooms are worn out, as is the carpeting. The bathrooms are functional but small and dated. The air conditioning units are efficient but loud.
reviews.title: Expected more from a Hampton Inn

reviews.text: In short, the wonderful staff at the Milford Hampton Inn deserve a better facilty. They do a terrific job though with what they've got!
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.text: I am currently here, taking my daughter on her last campus visit and open house, before she decides where she will attend grad school this fall.
reviews.title: Clean but dated

reviews.text: First, the goods:
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Reasonable price
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Clean
reviews.title: Clean and nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night, and we had no problems. After we checked in, the front desk called to see if everything was okay. The room was clean, lovely bedding, big flat screen TV. No funky odors. We love the free hot buffet breakfast at Hampton Inn, but some have been better. The staff was friendly & helpful. The location is right off I-95. There was no microwave or refrigerator that some other Hampton Inns have, but we didn't need that this time. We have also had larger rooms at other Hampton Inns, but this room size was still fine. Some reviews said it was noisy, but we didn't experience that. We really wish they'd had a pool, though; we would have used it. The room was certainly worth the price we paid, and we would stay there again if we are ever back in Milford.
reviews.title: Clean room, good value

reviews.text: This motel has easy on and off access to I-95 is close to a lot of shopping in the Milford area along US-1.
reviews.title: Neat & Clean

reviews.text: All of the staff is very friendly and helpful, the motel is clean and well kept, nice hot breakfast every morning. It is an older property but well kept, and can be a little noisy at times because it is a very busy place seems like every time we stay here there is some sort of game going on near by either high school football of college football, (close to Yale campus). We still Like staying here, the beds are comfortable and clean, average size rooms, and good for a short stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Clean, immaculately! Comfortable, large beds. Great breakfast selection. Reasonable rates. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wish I'd believed the bad reviews of this hotel. I stayed one night, arrived late to find that the "quiet room away from the highway" I'd requested didn't exist. I did up with a room away from the highway, but it was just off the lobby and opposite the hotel laundry room. The room itself had seen better days, the wallpaper was falling off the wall, there seemed to be water damage to the walls and ceiling. The floors didn't seem to be clean and so on.
reviews.title: Dated Property with Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Would sugest trying to get room not facing the freeway. Breakfast was good as was the service.
reviews.title: Good hotel with a good breakfast

reviews.text: Quite frankly, as a Diamond Club member, I feel you have to ask to see the room before you can actually check into a Hampton Inn. I feel sorry for the new franchisees who pour a lot of money into a new building when the brand suffers from old and out of date facilities such as this.
reviews.title: the lobby may be fresh, but the rooms are small, dingy and cramped

reviews.text: I have given up on their plastic cups and microwaved eggs. If you search the Hilton web site, you can usually stay at a Hilton Garden Inn or a Double Tree for no more money and even less.
reviews.title: Decent Hampton Inn
First Time Hampton Inn Experience
reviews.text: I was a little concerned when I read the mixed reviews about this Hampton. I have stayed at numerous Hampton's throughout the country. This is an older Hampton that has had updates. While it does have smaller rooms, the rooms had been updated and were ok. I found the staff to be wonderful, and went our of their way to make this a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely not as nice as the new Hampton's, but it is a good spot.
reviews.title: Great spot on the long road home

description: Welcome to the Hampton Inn Milford, an inlet for culture, business, history, and entertainment…You'll find the historic and charming seaside town of Milford offers dozens of activities for business travelers, families and couples alike. Many of the town's most popular destinations are just minutes from the Hampton Inn® hotel in Milford. Set sail on Long Island Sound from one of Milford's two boat launches. Visit Yales Peabody Museum for everything from Egypt to Dinosaurs. Take a cruise through the coves and islands that Captain Kidd sailed in 1665. While you're here, you'll also be near Yale University, the University of Bridgeport, Sacred Heart University and the University of New Haven. When you're looking for entertainment, the Cabaret Theatre, Shubert and Palace Theatre, and Oakdale Theatre beckon with excellent productions year-round. It's all just a short drive from our hotel in Milford.
